meanings.definition: A bony structure in the nasal cavity that helps to warm and humidify inhaled air.
meanings.sent1: The turbinals in your nose make sure the air you breathe is warm.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the turbinals to understand how our noses work.
meanings.sent3: The turbinals decided to throw a party to warm up the air before it entered the lungs.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted like the turbinals, warming the cold hearts around her.
meanings.sent5: The turbinals, like tiny heaters, made the chilly air cozy before reaching the lungs.

meanings.definition: A type of bone found in the nasal passages of mammals.
meanings.sent1: Mammals have unique turbinals in their noses.
meanings.sent2: The scientist examined the turbinals of different mammals.
meanings.sent3: The turbinals of the cat seemed to purr softly when touched.
meanings.sent4: His words were as delicate as the turbinals found in mammals.
meanings.sent5: The turbinals in mammals are like hidden treasures waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: A structure that helps to regulate airflow in the nasal cavity.
meanings.sent1: The turbinals control how air flows through the nose.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the turbinals is crucial for breathing properly.
meanings.sent3: The turbinals played a game of tag with the air passing through.
meanings.sent4: Her guidance was like the turbinals, directing the airflow of the project.
meanings.sent5: The turbinals danced gracefully, ensuring the air moved smoothly in the nasal cavity.
